Author: TonyL#3577
Content: Aha, so did you started this komodod daemon with `-pubkey= 026079f1eb76b1dc9b5746cd486e2b43e4b981ad52093e9f79cbf7bc80ee952530` param?

Author: TonyL#3577
Content: `komodo-cli.exe -ac_name=ChannelTest channelsopen 026079f1eb76b1dc9b5746cd486e2b43e4b981ad52093e9f79cbf7bc80ee952530` and if you're executing all calls on the same node - it seems you are opening channel which have no sense (between your wallet and your wallet)

Author: TonyL#3577
Content:
In `channelsopen` you have to specify a destination pubkey. 
First side (sender) is your wallet with "026079f1eb76b1dc9b5746cd486e2b43e4b981ad52093e9f79cbf7bc80ee952530" pubkey and second side (payments recipient) will be a wallet which belongs to pubkey which you specify in `channelsopen`

Author: SuSC135#6248
Content: no i started the daemon with another pubkey

Author: SuSC135#6248
Content: ``komodod.exe -ac_name=ChannelTest -ac_supply=10500000 -ac_reward=2500000000 -ac_halving=210000 -ac_perc=10000000  -ac_cc=2 -addressindex=1 -spentindex=1  -pubkey=0377cee24bd2b5f6c11ccc8c5cffe717abe5e7448ce1fa6f0f3d5285d01f7c0e37 &``

Author: TonyL#3577
Content:
Thats why you are getting this error: ```error code: -1
error message:
to use CC contracts, you need to launch daemon with valid -pubkey= for an address in your wallet
```

Author: TonyL#3577
Content: Because to use CC contracts, you need to launch daemon with valid -pubkey= for an address in your wallet

Author: TonyL#3577
Content: And valid pubkey for your wallet is `026079f1eb76b1dc9b5746cd486e2b43e4b981ad52093e9f79cbf7bc80ee952530`

Author: TonyL#3577
Content:
In general you can get a list of addresses:
```
./komodo-cli -ac_name=TONY7 getaddressesbyaccount ""
[
  "RJ8cuSGzBEVr7mD988tPVdMvTy2kgieJr6",
  "RNfviykgepoYjRL9ePcuHHuHJwxBGGVcgh",
  "RPCUimGv3pCz9wxErrtwJxFN713Uva57oH",
  "RPRn9JnSFmYVkyvRbBUxPZtKtdxojEbgWk",
  "RR37QdE7XMKcXSmQE8mZzxpMy9jMhtE1ef",
  "RXbSJSWangktGCmqWVxTjXTMQhXymYNryM",
  "RYYpCfudys4E3CAJyBq9KEv33NgCaiYoRw"
]
```
And then get a pubkey from each `validateaddress` for each address

Content: In general `pubkey=` daemon param needed for any CC operating, not just channelsCC

Author: TonyL#3577
Content:
Software version which you use most probably not compatible with current CC at all.

 `"connections": 0` also you have only one node now on your AC - so there is no nodes with which you can open your channel

Content:
```"blocks": 0,
  "longestchain": 0,```
On one of the nodes you might want to enable mining by `setgenerate true`

Content: https://github.com/KomodoPlatform/komodo/wiki/Installing-Komodo-Manually and you might use this one if want to compile komodod from scratch instead of fresh binaries usage from https://github.com/KomodoPlatform/komodo/releases/

Author: TonyL#3577
Content: @SuSC135 https://developers.komodoplatform.com/ also it might be a good place to start

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: @SuSC135 being able to compile the latest version of whichever KMD branch you want, is going to be very valuable. Until you get that working, make sure to use the very latest binaries you can find, usually only a few days/weeks old, as they are make frequently

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: @SuSC135 if you download (or already have the latest Agama wallet) and start Komodo in "native mode", that will actually start a full komodod process on your machine, and you can talk to it with komodo-cli

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: even so, cryptoconditions stuff is very new, and you might need to compile a certain branch, like FSM or jl777

Author: TonyL#3577
Content: Also anyway to compile Windows binaries from custom branches Ubuntu needed, so it might be a good idea to switch to Ubuntu in general and test everything on it

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: 16.04 minimal server in VM gives a 10GB image.... install komodo into that... then clone it to test. No problem to boot 2-4 of them on a reasonable PC with VirtualBox and test anything you need. Can even use windows as a host if you must. I did that early on before getting linux host working.

Author: smk762 -  dracocanis ominator#7640
Content:
` /home/komodo` is the user home folder.
` /home/komodo/.komodo` is the data folder.
if the data folder is owned by root, you cant create subfolders in it, even if all the files in it are owned by `komodo`

Content: **./komodod -ac_name=EXAMPLECHAIN -ac_supply=1000000 -addnode=<IP address of the first node> -gen -genproclimit=$(nproc)**

Content: `  "blocks": 0,` means block 1 was not mined

Author: Alright#0419
Content: once the nodes are connected, try `komodo-cli -ac_name=HELLOWORLD setgenerate true $(nproc)`

Content: you can do `komodo-cli -ac_name=HELLOWORLD getpeerinfo` to confirm they are connected
